thread.title: Volkswagen's new CEO says to consider asset sales

title: Volkswagen's new CEO says to consider asset sales
text:
April 13, 2018 / 9:08 AM / Updated 4 hours ago Volkswagen's new CEO says to consider asset sales Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
WOLFSBURG, Germany (Reuters) - Volkswagen’s ( VOWG_p.DE ) new Chief Executive Herbert Diess on Friday said he will consider asset sales and seeks to turn the multi-brand conglomerate into a slimmed down company with strong brands. Herbert Diess, Volkswagen's new CEO addresses the media during a news conference at the Volkswagen plant in Wolfsburg, Germany April 13, 2018. REUTERS/Fabian Bimmer 
Speaking at his first news conference as chief executive at VW’s headquarters in Wolfsburg, Diess said he would look at the different assets in VW’s portfolio, which include Renk and MAN Diesel, and review whether keeping them makes sense. 
“We will review all options,” Diess said, adding that this could include investing in the businesses or pursuing a sale. Reporting by Andreas Cremer; Writing by Edward Taylor; Editing by Maria Sheahan
